title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Gather requirements for the WorkloadBalanceAnalyzer tool, including data sources, analysis methods, and output formats.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including components, data flow, integration points, data storage, security considerations, and scalability strategies.

title: Design Data Collection and Storage
description: Design the data collection and storage mechanisms for capturing work patterns and task assignments. The design should consider data privacy, security, and compliance with relevant regulations. It should also address scalability, performance, and data retention policies.

title: Design Analysis and Reporting
description: Design the analysis algorithms and reporting mechanisms for identifying potential overwork or uneven task distribution. The analysis should consider factors such as task duration, complexity, deadlines, and employee workload capacity. The reporting mechanism should provide clear visualizations and actionable insights to help managers and employees balance workloads effectively.

title: Design User Interface
description: Design the user interface for configuring the tool, viewing reports, and managing opt-in settings.

title: Plan Security and Privacy Measures
description: Develop a plan for ensuring data privacy and security, including access controls and data encryption.

title: Plan Deployment and Operations
description: Develop a comprehensive plan for deploying and operating the WorkloadBalanceAnalyzer tool, including infrastructure requirements, monitoring and logging strategies, maintenance schedules, and disaster recovery procedures.

title: Create Test Plan
description: Develop a comprehensive test plan for validating the functionality and performance of the WorkloadBalanceAnalyzer tool.

title: Develop Documentation
description: Create comprehensive user guides, technical documentation, and other supporting materials for the WorkloadBalanceAnalyzer tool. The documentation should cover installation, configuration, usage scenarios, troubleshooting, and API references (if applicable). Ensure that the documentation is well-structured, easy to understand, and up-to-date with the latest features and changes.
